alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 9:10PM EST until January 13 at 10:36PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... White River. .Rainfall of 1.00 to 1.50 inches across southwestern Indiana this past Saturday night is prolonging minor flooding on the lower White River, from near Petersburg to Hazleton. The river level is expected to hover less than two feet above flood stage until Thursday at which point it should drop below flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding affects low agricultural lands, low oil fields and closes Bottoms Rd...Brothers Rd and East Govenors Road in Knox County. In agricultural season...farmers are concerned at this stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Tuesday /7:30 PM CST Tuesday/ the stage was 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Tuesday /7:30 PM CST Tuesday/ was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Wednesday morning by around 1100 AM CST /1200 PM EST/.
